title: US tech titan earnings rise on AI as economy roils
description:
Tech giants Amazon, Apple, Meta and Microsoft this week eclipsed earnings expectations, cashing in on artificial intelligence (AI) while navigating economic waters roiled by US tariffs.-
Meta reported robust second-quarter financial results Wednesday, with revenue jumping 22 percent year-over-year as the social media giant continues investing heavily in artificial intelligence.
content:
Amazon Web Services, the cloud computing division at the e-commerce giant helped power quarterly earnings that beat market expectations (RONNY HARTMANN) (RONNY HARTMANN/AFP/AFP)

title: Apple's AI Ambitions: A Shift from Fiscal Frugality to Strategic Spending
description: Apple is shifting its approach to artificial intelligence, with CEO Tim Cook suggesting potential acquisitions and increased spending on data centers to compete with industry leaders Microsoft and Google's ambitious AI initiatives. This marks a departure from Apple's traditionally frugal spending strategy.
content: In a groundbreaking shift, Apple CEO Tim Cook announced plans on Thursday to increase investments in artificial intelligence. The tech giant is considering larger acquisitions and expanding its data center operations to keep up with industry leaders ... [731 chars]

title: Apple tops Wall Street expectations with strong iPhone sales
description: Apple shook off a thicket of tariffs and a botched entry into artificial intelligence to accelerate its revenue growth during its springtime quarter, but the trendsetting company still faces a bumpy road ahead that could lead to higher iPhone prices.

title: Apple Surges Ahead Despite Tariff Challenges and AI Delays
description: Apple reported fiscal third-quarter results exceeding expectations with $94.04 billion in revenue. Sales of iPhones increased notably. Despite tariff concerns and AI development delays, Apple maintains growth through strategic production shifts. Apple faced challenges in markets, while continuing to innovate in artificial intelligence and sustain its services business.
content:
Apple Inc. delivered far stronger-than-expected fiscal third-quarter results, reporting $94.04 billion in revenue, surpassing analyst predictions. Notably, iPhone sales grew by 13.5% to $44.58 billion, alleviating some tariff-related concerns.
